$schema_description: AEGIS Gold Standard Case - CDI (Clostridioides difficile Infection)
$instructions: Copy this template for each adjudicated case. Fill in all fields. Use null for facts not documented in clinical notes (distinct from false, which means documented-as-absent).

timing_assessment.notes: Specimen collected day 5 (>3 days) = Healthcare-facility onset (HO-CDI)

recurrence_assessment.notes: No prior CDI LabID events in system. This is an incident case.

co_hcfa_assessment.notes: Not applicable - this is HO-CDI, not CO-CDI

source_note.author: Dr. Park
source_note.relevant_text_location: Overnight events: 'Developed 8 episodes of watery diarrhea'

prior_cdi_history.notes: No prior CDI documented in notes

source_note.author: Dr. Park
source_note.relevant_text_location: Assessment: 'CDI likely antibiotic-associated, on ceftriaxone/azithro x4 days'

source_note.author: Dr. Park
source_note.relevant_text_location: Assessment: 'Concern for C. diff given watery diarrhea on antibiotics'

source_note.author: Dr. Park
source_note.relevant_text_location: Update: 'C. diff PCR positive, starting oral vancomycin'

expected_classification.criterion_pathway: Positive C. diff PCR on unformed stool. Specimen collected day 5 (>3 days after admission) = Healthcare-facility onset. No prior CDI events = Incident case.

hallucination_risks: H&P mentions 'no recent diarrhea' on admission - LLM must recognize diarrhea developed AFTER admission.
Note mentions 'patient reports loose stools at home occasionally' - this is baseline, not current CDI symptoms.
Day 3 note mentions 'bowel sounds present' - not relevant to diarrhea assessment.
Nursing note documents 'incontinent episode' - must determine if this is diarrhea or incontinence.
rationale: 71yo admitted for CAP, started on ceftriaxone and azithromycin. Day 5 developed 8 episodes of watery diarrhea. C. diff PCR sent and positive. Stool was unformed. Started on oral vancomycin, ceftriaxone and azithromycin discontinued. Meets NHSN CDI LabID criteria: positive PCR on unformed stool. Specimen day 5 (>3 days) = HO-CDI. No prior CDI = Incident case. Healthcare-facility onset, incident CDI.
